item.title: Ida
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:3, topic:289665”]Yes I have, why? Do you have a question?

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=382867.msg2875242#msg2875242 date=1248010319]

[quote author=frank_ link=topic=382867.msg2875057#msg2875057 date=1247998673]
has anybody used it?
[/quote]I’ve used it a little for cracking a few commercial applications in the past (i preferred OllyDBG though because i’m more used to that), why?
[/quote]It’s not really fair to compare IDA with OllyDbg. IDA Pro is a disassembler whereas OllyDbg is a debugger. I’ve found that to be more efficient it is best to use both simultaneously. Mainly because IDA Pro has amazing instruction comments, but its functionality gets limited at the fact it isn’t a debugger. Browse with IDA, patch with Olly.[/quote]I never compared them to eachother, i just say I prefer OllyDbg due to being used to it. I have nothing aganist IDA.

Read full topic

item.title: Ida
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

Yes I have, why? Do you have a question?

[quote=“Speljohan, post:2, topic:289665”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=382867.msg2875057#msg2875057 date=1247998673]
has anybody used it?
[/quote]I’ve used it a little for cracking a few commercial applications in the past (i preferred OllyDBG though because i’m more used to that), why?[/quote]It’s not really fair to compare IDA with OllyDbg. IDA Pro is a disassembler whereas OllyDbg is a debugger. I’ve found that to be more efficient it is best to use both simultaneously. Mainly because IDA Pro has amazing instruction comments, but its functionality gets limited at the fact it isn’t a debugger. Browse with IDA, patch with Olly.

Read full topic
